feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly implements working financial tools (doubling-time rule of 72 plus compound, simple, savings goal, and inflation calculators) and includes a learning component, demonstrating the application functions as a financial app. Driver stages (Discover/Implement/Reflect) show intent, development, and iteration consistent with a passing financial application.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission claims an "AI powered" product but provides only descriptions of standard calculators and a static learn function with no concrete AI features, workflows, or examples of AI adding value. Because AI integration is missing or superficial in the implementation and reflected discussion, the criterion is not met.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "And so what I decided to build is a uh through replet is my is a rule of 72 calculator."
"However, I did want to create to make it be a learning tool for people."

"However, I also wanted this not just to be a one-dimensional calculator and really have the multi-dimensionality of a variety of financial calculators and hence as you can see there's a compound a simple a savings goal and an inflation calculator."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — student identified the capstone as an AI-powered financial innovation (rule of 72). Implement — student built functioning calculators (rule of 72, compound, simple, savings goal, inflation). Reflect — student iterated to add learning features and multi-dimensionality to improve usability.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly implements working financial tools (doubling-time rule of 72 plus compound, simple, savings goal, and inflation calculators) and includes a learning component, demonstrating the application functions as a financial app. Driver stages (Discover/Implement/Reflect) show intent, development, and iteration consistent with a passing financial application.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "Hello, my name is Ethan Menona and today I'm going to be doing the capstone project which is to build my own AI powered um financial innovation."
"And so what I decided to build is a uh through replet is my is a rule of 72 calculator."
"And so I decided to give a learn function for people to learn more about the core concepts regarding the rule of 72 calculator ... all done through replet."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student asserts an "AI powered" project intent.  
Implement: describes building a rule-of-72 calculator and learning function but gives no details of AI mechanisms.  
Reflect: student discusses improving the tool for learning/engagement but does not describe AI-specific integration or behavior.
criteria.reasoning: The submission claims an "AI powered" product but provides only descriptions of standard calculators and a static learn function with no concrete AI features, workflows, or examples of AI adding value. Because AI integration is missing or superficial in the implementation and reflected discussion, the criterion is not met.
